member.name: T:Microsoft.Uii.Desktop.UI.Core.DesktopBase
member.summary:
DesktopBase Class is the anchor class for all Core functions. This class is responsible for the “plumbing” of a desktop. This includes adding and removing sessions, managing notifications, the current view of applications, default operational behaviors for Workflow management in relationship to current application views, access to Service utility functions and methods and Loading and Login of an Agent Desktop. This class provides override hooks to allow the end developer to intercept, take action, modify Core Desktop behavior.
This class is not intended to be directly invoked. It is intended as a base class to be overridden by a custom desktop Implementation The methods are intended to be overridden by a inheriting class and are call by the core system itself.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Desktop.UI.Core.DesktopBase.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a new instance of the Desktop Class. This class is the core class for all operations for an IAD.
member.param: Name of the product. this is used for exceptions and logging

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Desktop.UI.Core.DesktopBase.InitializeDesktop(Microsoft.Uii.Csr.Sessions)
member.summary: This method begins the initializing process for the core system. This is a threaded process that begins a series of events involved with loading the Agent Desktop Core system. See Remarks for details.
member.remarks: This method executes asynchronously. Once initiated it connects to the parent desktops “Form_Loaded” event. When that event is raised by the Desktop loading process the main loading process for the Desktop begins. To get the stats of this process, Connect Event handlers to LoaderStatusUpdated, LoaderAppLoadingStatusUpdated and LoaderComplete.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Uii.Desktop.UI.Core.DesktopBase.MaxNumberOfSessionsPermitted
member.summary:
Returns the Max Number of Sessions that are permitted in this configuration This will check the local value of maxNumberOfSessions First, if it does not find that it will attempt to find it on the Server in Options.
Default return is 10.
member.remarks: This method looks in the local application configuration in the appsettings node for the key maxNumberOfSessions. If it is found, the number present is returned to the calling method, if not the method makes a call to the Configuration server to retrieved maxNumberOfSessions. On the configuration server this value is stored in the Options Node and is called maxNumberOfSessions.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Uii.Desktop.UI.Core.DesktopBase.AppHost
member.summary: Application Host Container of the Active Session. The Application Host Container Contains references to all current “inscope” hosted applications. It also provides several methods for accessing information about the applications and adding and removing them.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Uii.Desktop.UI.Core.DesktopBase.EnableSaveSession
member.summary: Flag that indicates that Session Save Operations are permitted or not permitted. This is set based on Server Configuration. This flag is used to determine if a session should be saved to the Server for backup or transfer.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Uii.Desktop.UI.Core.DesktopBase.ConfigurationReader
member.summary: Configuration Reader. This Reader provides access to the configuration system to pull data stored in either the local app.config or the Server’s Configuration database.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.Desktop.UI.Core.TopMostMessageBox.Show(System.String,System.String,System.Windows.Forms.MessageBoxButtons)
member.summary: Displays a message box in front of the specified object and with the specified text, caption, and buttons.
member.param: The text to display in the message box.
The text to display in the title bar of the message box.
One of the values that specifies which buttons to display in the message box.
member.returns: One of the values.
member.exception: buttons is not a member of .
An attempt was made to display the in a process that is not running in User Interactive mode. This is specified by the property.

One of the values that specifies which icon to display in the message box.
